Subjective: Sore right eye. Redness, irritation, feels like hair or speck in eye. Unable to play tennis due to fatigue. No fever, cough, or shortness of breath. No smoking, no alcohol. Works, manages well with daughter. Boyfriend away on holiday. No other day cream or mascara. No other eye problems. No pain when looking normally, but feels uncomfortable. No extra pain from light.
Objective: BP: 120/80. HR: 70. Temp: 36.8Â°C. Right eye: redness, red veins, swollen. Left eye: mild redness. Pupils: normal reaction. Vision: normal.
Assessment: Inflammation of surface layer of right eye, likely viral. Redness, irritation, and discomfort. Left eye may be infected.
Plan: Explain: viral infection, will heal on its own.
Lifestyle: avoid rubbing, rinse with lukewarm tap water.
Safety netting: call if pain, pus, stuck shut, or seeing things.
